title: Home Brew "Good God" title font
content:
Hi there,

Can anybody help me ID this font? Not even sure what to call the style... seems like a condensed version of something similar to Brothers..

Thanks,  
Nick

Font: 

 The Youth's Companion 

Solved By: 

 [osamu](http://web.archive.org/web/20150422054839/http:/typophile.com/user/215937 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Screen Shot 2014-02-09 at 9.23.20 pm.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150422054839/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202014-02-09%20at%209.23.20%20pm.png) | 209.58 KB |
author: nickfracture

comments.content: [The Youth's Companion](http://web.archive.org/web/20150422054839/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/coffee-bin-fonts/youths-companion/) by Billy Jacobs (Coffee Bin Fonts).

As for what to call the style, the inward curving vertical strokes are a feature of the mid Victorian fonts called Tuscan [Gothic] Concave. The font for Home Brew Good God is a later style that mixes this with features from other styles such as the extended flat bottoms & tops on D and B first found in a font patented by James Connor in 1878

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150422054839im_/http:/typophile.com/files/D9433_18780808Connor_4473.jpg)
  
Don
